page.title: 08NURSERY _ DURDAR,CARLISLE(I)
page.content: The business on Durdar Rd. was started by the present owner's grandfather and his brother in 1891.They split up and his grandfather moved to the present 6.5 acre site in 1906.The nursery is fully mechanised with a tractor,2 rotovators,a spading machine and a grubber.A lot of plants and cuttings are imported from Holland but they are beginning to grow more of their own each year.Four full_time people, including Mr.Leslie,work about 8.5 hours a day.There is one part_time worker also.They grow a large variety of hardy plants including flowers, vegetables,trees and shrubs.A lot of commercially produced fertilisers and composts are used as well as their own composts.In a hard winter they nearly always lose some plants but they do not usually have many problems during summer droughts.
